results.title: VP of Product
results.description:
About Us

Qualio is on a mission to empower life science teams to launch and scale life-saving products. We’re doing that by building a connected and integrated quality management platform for the entire life science ecosystem. Qualio is trusted by 100s of highly regulated international customers, ranging from the bleeding edge of computational biology and machine learning to household names in mRNA vaccine development.

The Qualio team is all-remote and currently distributed across North America and Europe.

What’s the opportunity?

We are looking for a VP of Product to build and lead a world-class product organization. The mission of the VP of Product is to own the product vision for Qualio and take responsibility for translating it to our roadmap and from there to our customers. When successful, you will be an instrumental part in enabling 100,000 teams to launch life-saving products and medicines, powered by Qualio.

What will I be doing?
  • Set the vision for the Product Management team and take a leading role in setting the vision of the company, providing strategic direction for the product, and influencing the direction of other groups in Qualio
  • Implementing/maintaining clear product metrics that enable us to understand customer engagement and opportunities to improve the product
  • Identify opportunities to build products/features that take advantage of product-led growth
  • Improve our product ideation and prioritization process to be the market leader, as measured by high customer adoption, engagement, satisfaction, and retention, and partner with engineering to deliver on the roadmap
  • Create metrics representing business performance and customer satisfaction and use those metrics to drive behavior and make data-driven decisions
  • Define the value proposition of the Product Management team and represent that value to stakeholders through the delivery of appropriate metrics and performance indicators that measure progress against your strategy
  • Challenge existing standards of product excellence and propose new standards continuously
  • Create a culture of continuous, systematic improvement within the Product Management team
  • Anticipate potential sources of failure, drive improvements to existing product features, and create new ones to overcome any setbacks
Requirements - What skills do I need?
  • 10+ years experience in product management in B2B cloud SaaS applications
  • Passion for leading, mentoring, and scaling product teams to reach their full potential
  • A healthy level of skepticism and an analytical nature with the ability to quickly absorb and analyze unfamiliar information to make decisions that are supported by sound evidence
  • Prioritization and decision-making in complex situations with competing inputs
  • Ability to see and communicate the big picture in an inspiring way
  • Experience designing and building metrics for product engagement and customer satisfaction
  • Experience managing feature sets and requirements in a complex domain or marketplace
  • Experience developing software products in a regulated space, subject to the constraints and norms of the industry
Benefits 
  • Competitive salary
  • Matching 401k
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
  • Dependent & Health FSA, Short/Long Term Disability, Basic & Voluntary Life Insurance
  • Unlimited PTO policy
  • Company allowance for home office supplies
  • 12 weeks of paid parental leave
  • Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products get to market

results.title: Principal Product Manager, Analytics
results.description:
Our growing Product Team is looking for a humble and hungry Principal Product Manager to help lead our Analytics, DataLake, and Reporting experiences. These products provide invaluable insight and actionable information for finance, project management, and leadership users of our feature-rich and open Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) platform.  

You will contribute to the strategic vision and own the delivery of our analytics and reporting solutions. With over 3,500 customers and a robust partner network, your actions and contributions will have far-reaching impacts on our project-based ERP software offering. 

What You'll Do 

  • Develop a deep understanding of user personas across business lines; leverage the same to be the sounding board for internal and external stakeholders and customers
  • Collaborate and contribute to building and updating our product roadmap for analytics, reporting, and DataLake
  • Transition proof-of-concepts to production-ready features
  • Partner with numerous stakeholders and cross-functional teams to execute our roadmap, including sprint planning and objective prioritization of features and issues
  • Become a Unanet go-to product expert; guide your scrum teams in troubleshooting production-escalation issues with your team leadership skills; train internal and external customers on new product features, capabilities, data objects, and integrations
  • Set your engineering team up for success in sprint activities, providing them with relevant user stories and guiding them in estimation
  • Reduce friction in our Agile processes when the situation calls for adjustments or changes in both the sprint and the overall strategic plan

Your First 90 Days 

In your First 30 Days, you will grow in your understanding of Unanet through the lens of our current product offerings. You will learn what is slated to be delivered over the coming two (2) quarters. With this knowledge, you will help clarify and realign existing requirements, writing epics and user stories as well as refining them with your team.  

In your First 60 Days, you will build relationships with internal and external stakeholders and help them understand our product direction and the reasoning behind it. You will understand the strategic direction of your product as well as related Unanet products and how they all work together. In partnership with your Group Product Manager and our User Experience Team, you will question, redefine, revalidate and solidify our roadmap deliverables based on your expertise and learnings. 

In your First 90 Days, you will drive our release and Go-to-Market (GTM) plan for the Analytics product deliverables. You will use the Analytics product roadmap to make commitments, evaluate client suggestions, and define metrics for adoption and engagement. You will be the guiding light for your scrum teams, helping them execute on the committed product deliverables.  

Who You Are 

  • 7+ years of B2B SaaS product management experience in an Agile environment
  • Prior experience working with analytics, data visualization, BI tooling, accounting, financials, government contracting (GovCon), or financial reporting
  • Product strategist with ability to align vision to defined outcomes
  • Strong ability to capture, detail, and explain market and technical requirements
  • Strong technical writing and visualization skills
  • Demonstrable ability to understand and evaluate customer and end-user needs
  • Depth of experience planning and supporting multi-functional web applications in production, with deploying new products and major functionality
  • Ability to identify gaps, program risks and proactively address them
  • Bias for action and execution on both short- and long-term strategic product plans

Your Differentiators 

  • Prior experience working with ERP financials and/or have an accounting background

Our Values 

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.
  • We do the right thing and have fun in the process.

The salary range for this opportunity is $140,000 – 160,000 per year. You will be eligible for employee equity as well as discretionary bonus compensation, subject to plans that may be in effect from time to time. You will further be eligible to participate in Unanet's employee benefits plans and programs. For more details on Unanet's benefits offerings, please visit https://unanet.com/employee-benefits. 

Unanet is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for positions without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
Sporty's sites are some of the most popular on the internet, consistently staying in Alexa's list of top websites for the countries they operate in.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Description: 

Shift5 is seeking a full-time Product Manager, with a specific focus on our DoD customers, to join our growing team. In this role, you’ll have an opportunity to make an immediate impact on real world operations and problems we’re solving for our customers. You’ll learn about capability gaps in existing defense platforms, engage with customers and users, synthesize and analyze feedback, and build the product infrastructure to support our goals. Your primary responsibilities will be to act as the voice of the customer while supporting our product vision and strategy.

We are looking for someone who thrives while working in partnership with engineers, designers, and other stakeholders. The ability to translate complex technical scenarios into simplified stories and requirements is absolutely essential for this role. We operate in a fast-paced environment with competing and evolving priorities and you’ll be expected to do the same. The ideal candidate for this position is someone who is comfortable living in ambiguity and can self prioritize and self direct daily tasks and requirements. If this sounds like you, drop us a line because we’d love to hear from you.

Shift5 is a rapidly growing data and cybersecurity scale-up. We specialize in capturing and analyzing serial bus data in real time, providing anomaly detection and operational intelligence required to act. Our insights provide real-time alerting and historical trends to assure mission readiness and cyber survivability, and our innovative technology enables military systems to deter adversaries, protect warfighters, and maintain their competitive edge. We are a collaborative, passionate and driven cadre of cyber security experts. Our engineers are multidisciplinary, and our team is dynamic. We’re a growing company focused on helping our customer’s fleets run smarter and safer by capitalizing on mountains of data resting right about the wheels. Come join us.

In this role you will be expected to:

  • Identify, explore and learn about gaps in defense capabilities, engage with customers and users, synthesize and analyze feedback, and build a product infrastructure to support our goals
  • Define solutions
  • Identify and define potential features that will accelerate Shift5’s goals
  • Set clear outcomes for your area of responsibility in partnership with  engineering, design and other key stakeholders
  • Effectively communicate product vision and strategy
  • Proactively communicate goals to stakeholders and manage delivery expectations
  • Work hands-on to deliver new capabilities across the lifecycle of the product, from initial release and implementation, through up-keep and day to day improvements
  • Collaborate with Sales and Marketing to communicate product capabilities to customers and other key stakeholders

We're looking for someone who is/has:

  • BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or you’re technically savvy enough to ask engineers good questions about architecture decisions and understand the answers
  • 3+ years experience implementing and/or supporting software development or enterprise network capabilities, with specific experience in a hands-on product management role
  • Demonstrated ability to work with internal and external stakeholders across a wide range of technical comfort
  • Demonstrated experience turning conflicting or incomplete ideas into concrete action plans
  • At least a baseline understanding and experience working with DoD platforms and systems, experience within DoD fleet maintenance is a plus
  • Experience and understanding of non standard network serial protocols such as MIL STD-1553, J-1939, CANBUS and/or ARINC 429, is a huge plus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.
  • US Citizenship
  • Active (or ability to hold/obtain) a US Government Top Secret security clearance

Compensation & Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and stock options in a fast-growing startup
  • Employer-paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their families
  • Health Savings Account with annual employer contributions
  • 401k with employer contributions
  • Employer-paid Life Insurance
  • Uncapped paid time off policy
  • Flexible work & remote work policy
  • Tax-deferred public transit benefits with Metro SmartBenefits (DC/MD/VA)

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that embraces the diversity of our people and represents the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems. We strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. 

Shift5 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, marital status, ancestry, projected veteran status, or any other protected group or class.

results.title: Associate Product Manager - Scanner Pro team
results.description:
“Scanner Pro is perhaps the best app for quickly scanning and saving a digital version of a paper document.” – New York Times Scanner Pro by Readdle is a revolutionary application that redefined the AppStore scanning category. It uses a built-in iOS camera to take pictures of a paper document. The unique technology automatically detects the edges, fixes geometry, and removes shadows and other visual defects to make a perfect scan. Also, it harnessed an advanced optical character recognition (OCR) technology that allows you to extract text from scans.
 
Readdle is looking for an Associate Product Manager. We need a team member who is capable of taking innovative, conceptual ideas and turning them into something useful for the millions of Scanner Pro users.



What you will do:
  • Organized scrum process in the team (Scrum Master)
  • Execution of product manager tasks where the product has time shortage to achieve product/business goals
  • Product documentation is maintained in an actual state according to the standard templates (Jira, feature/experiment documents, dashboards)
  • Manage execution of product experiments and create artifacts with results to inform all participants of the execution process and final results
  • Gather and organize accessible data (competitors' assets analysis, research, analytics, customer feedback) in a form that drives decision-making
  • Own the team's company-wide communication (status updates, inner beta testing, etc.)
  • Take the role of feature owner (coordination and decision-making) for defined features
  • Approve deliverables for complying to according specifications



About you:
  • 2+ years of project management experience in the IT industry
  • Good understanding of the SDLC, Agile/Scrum methodologies
  • A good level of English to feel confident within the international team
  • Proactive and independent, well-organized, able to do hands-on work and analysis with minimum supervision



What you will get:
  • Customer-centric culture. We put our customers first. It means that every employee can benefit from interacting with our customers directly. It enables us to create and deliver the best solutions for millions of our users
  • Professional growth. We are professionals at everything we do. It means we own our decisions, our work, and our results. We provide quality feedback to others and welcome feedback as an opportunity to learn and improve
  • A team of amazing people. The greatest power we have is the team. It means we care about each other, ensure transparency, and invest in everyone's success
  • Impact on our products. We aim to create valuable products. It means that we improve ourselves constantly by overcoming constraints, simplifying our processes, and improving our capacity
  • Innovative culture. We try to be innovative and creative in everything we do. It means that we expect, appreciate and value new ideas

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
At Emburse our mission is to help make our users’ lives – and their businesses – better. We are dramatically transforming how organizations manage corporate expenses and invoices. We humanize work by automating manual tasks and saving users’ time, so they can focus on what matters most – their family, community, or more rewarding work. We help CFO’s give their employees a simple and amazing experience while ensuring compliance and reducing costs. Our solutions are tailored for companies from start-ups and SMBs to enterprises such as Microsoft, Pinterest, Bosch, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and Estee Lauder. We have more than 18,000 customers and 12 million users globally.

The Product Manager shapes the overall vision of software products and applications through collaboration with clients and internal software developers, design, account management / sales, and marketing teams.


What You'll Do
  • Responsible for driving product development for a major product focus area spanning more than one full engineering team
  • Collaborate on building business case, defining product vision and strategy
  • Create systems and processes to capture qualitative insights (pain points, performance issues, support tickets, feature requests etc.) and track product analytics (usage, adoption, retention and conversion behaviors) and structure, organize and surface this information to guide product design, iteration and prioritization for maximum business impact
  • Communicate status of project with stakeholders
  • Manage the prioritized feature backlog and bug process
  • Create clear and concise product specs, test, iterate and drive to launch, partnering with Engineers and Designers on product development
  • Drive consensus and identify key metrics for upcoming projects
  • As primary accountable for delivery of the roadmap: facilitate expedient decision-making with business teams, oversee the development process with product and engineering teams and shepherd the go-to-market process with sales, marketing, training and customer support teams
  • Own features, end to end
  • Study market trends and competitive offerings, research, monitor, and analyze industry and competitive trends regularly; provide updates and recommendations to supervisor
  • Lead analyses of the competitive environment, customers and product metrics to determine the right set of features to drive engagement and usage of assigned applications/products 
  • Engage with prospective ecosystem partners and internal business development teams to showcase the product, understand integration needs and support execution required to earn these partnerships

  • Bachelor’s degree in communications, marketing, economics, public relations, statistics, advertising, management or related field, or equivalent experience

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
At Human API, we exist to radically accelerate the pace of health innovation for everyone. That is our vision. We unlock siloed health data from everywhere and put it directly into the hands of the consumer, right when they need it: enabling a meaningful transaction that creates value in their lives. Some call us the "PayPal" of health data, but our dreams are bigger. 

To name a few examples, we help rapidly screen participants for clinical trials, enable life-changing software through accurate wearable data, and we accelerate the buying process for important insurance products.  Tomorrow we will inspire the innovation of impactful digital health products to maximize human longevity and potential. We are looking for talent who are equally inspired by these big ideas and have the grit and determination to make them come to life.

As a Product Owner, you’ll support the execution of product solutions for our core vertical markets; Life Insurance and Life Sciences.  This role will translate our strategic roadmap into a clear, functional backlog and then drive the  development of these new capabilities. The ultimate goal of this role is to build and deliver the right features at the right time to maximize revenue growth, client satisfaction and solution adoption.   

Human API is a product led company. This is an opportunity to make a major impact on our company and the healthcare industry at large. 


What you'll do
  • Drive the solutioning process to convert high level roadmap items into detailed epics and user stories that feed our execution backlog
  • Represent the voice of the user and define minimum viable scope for each item on the roadmap
  • Manage the tradeoffs within each epic to balance scope, time and resources while delivering on the epic’s goal 
  • Work with Customer Success and Operational Teams to understand, scope and prioritize customer friction points and product bugs within the context of larger strategic priorities.
  • Write clear, verifiable acceptance criteria
  • Participate in validation of completed stories throughout the sprint
  • Demo completed functionality at sprint reviews
  • Build trusted relationships with cross-functional teams in order to deliver predictable, high-quality outcomes
  • Tirelessly chase down open questions, blockers, and dependencies.  
  • Stay true to our values, including serve the human first; which means prioritizing consumer transparency, trust and privacy


About You
  • 2+ years of relevant product owner or product manager experience working with SaaS, B2B software, or enterprise software platforms
  • Experience effectively working in an Agile Scrum environment 
  • Experience owning a product backlog and prioritizing features
  • Former practice with the process of product definition and validation; delivering MVP products and then iterating to improve them
  • Ready to be in a remote-first work culture and the sense of accountability to be successful in it.
  • Business Minded. Eager and able to connect each new feature to the business value they provide to our customers. 
  • Good product intuition; you can gather insights and synthesize customer needs into clear product requirements and roadmap.
  • The ability to influence people to get things done across the organization, striving to remove complexity and simplify both ideas and communication
  • Familiarity and comfort with the pace of an early stage company


Bonus
  • Previous experience with medical data 
  • Specific experience within Life Insurance or Life Sciences industries
The national, annual salary range for this position is $100,000 to $115,000 commensurate with experience.

We’re built by strong venture backing from Andreessen Horowitz, Blue Run Ventures, SCOR Global, Allianz, Guardian Life Insurance Company, and Samsung Ventures and currently serve some of the largest financial and health companies in the world from Prudential, Allstate, John Hancock, Omada Health, Thrive Global, AAA, and many more. 

We have thousands of API integrations into enterprise health record systems, wearable devices, as well as health and wellness applications, that all benefit the end consumer and our enterprise customers.  We’re looking for independent thinkers who care deeply about the problems we’re trying to solve. At Human API, we welcome people of all backgrounds.

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
SUMMARY

As a Product Owner in our Client Delivery team you will define, prioritize, and evaluate the work based on Client requirements for new implementations, change requests and maintenance upgrades to optimize the business value delivered by your scrum team. You will work with subject matter experts at our customers and within Vestmark to develop the user stories for product enhancements and oversee product enhancements throughout the development lifecycle.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS*

  • Participate in discovery alongside key stakeholders ensuring a significant understanding of requirements to share with the development team.
  • Partner with Products to understand new features
  • Coordinate, facilitate and/or conduct as needed demonstrations
  • Manage Change Request assignments with the scrum team and ascertain priority and timing expectations with the client/RM
  • Manage upgrades and maintenance releases with scrum team
  • Work with internal/external client teams to document business requirements
  • Write internal/external user stories and acceptance criteria and conduct walkthroughs as needed
  • Refine user stories with the scrum team
  • Establish priorities, collaborating with client or internal relationship managers when needed
  • Prioritize interruptions against sprint work
  • Maintain scrum team backlog
  • Creating & Maintaining epics for projects
  • Owning the status of an epic and ensuring they are closed when work is complete
  • Strive to have 1-3 future sprints planned
  • Work with scrum master to resolve impediments preventing team from meeting sprint goals
  • Be available for adhoc questions raised by the scrum team
  • Testing on adhoc basis as needed

PREPARATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Experience: 3+ years’ experience as a Product Owner or Business Analyst with knowledge of Agile process and principles
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Financial industry knowledge, particularly in the areas of portfolio management, portfolio accounting, or trading operations
  • Familiarity with the data associated with the processing of securities, transactions, and positions of either retail or institutional portfolios
  • Experience with software delivery
  • Enterprise software company experience or experience in a professional services organization delivering enterprise software used by financial services organizations
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong and effective customer service skills
  • Bright with a high degree of initiative to learn and work collaboratively to solve problems
  • Do what it takes attitude, displaying positive energy even in challenging situations
  • Strong communication skills; able to respond and exchange ideas clearly and effectively through writing, speaking, and presentations; shares appropriate information to keep people informed

COMPETENCIES

  • Teamwork – We before me-- Puts needs of team first and aspires to bring out the best in others; collaborative, empathetic and humble; values the opinions of others; assists others when needed; participates effectively as member of a team; balances personal contributions and needs with those of other members of the team to achieve common objectives.
  • Knowledge Explorer – Creative problem solver and adapts to challenges at hand using creative collaboration; curious, proactive and resourceful; able to incorporate other viewpoints as part of the process of developing solutions
  • Positive Energy – Ability to address difficult situations with humor and sense of opportunity; approachable, constructive and engaged
  • Own It- Empathetic and accountable until the end.

WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Willingness to travel occasionally on as needed basis. 

BENEFITS

  • Vestmark pays 90% of Medical and Dental insurance premium
  • Vestmark sponsored Life, STD, and LTD Benefits
  • Generous PTO
  • Company equity in the form of Restricted Stock Units
  • 401(k) with Employer Matching
  • Employee Assistance Program

 

Vestmark is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Vestmark prohibits employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability status, protected military or veteran status, and genetic information.

This role cannot be performed by a resident of New York City, NY.

results.title: Head of Product - Rider Experience
results.description:
Description

About Masabi:

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work, and visit by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company developing a fare collection platform that allows people to buy and present tickets for public transit on their mobile phones or by tapping a bank card or smart card to travel. 

 

We believe a new fare payments system allowing passengers to tap and ride without needing to buy a ticket or understand fares should be available to every passenger and every transit agency around the globe, without prohibitive costs or taking years to deliver, helping people move seamlessly from A to B.

 

Our Justride platform has won numerous awards and is used in over 150 locations worldwide, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, Valencia, The Hague, Los Angeles, Melbourne, and many more. With an exciting industry-first mobile ticketing SDK, we are partnering with companies like Uber, Lyft, Transit, Moovit to enable the purchase of public transit tickets within leading mobility applications.

 

Join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.

 

 

The Role: 

We’re looking for a Head of Rider Experience Products to own the products and integrations that Masabi builds to make riding transit an easy and enjoyable experience for our global users. 

 

The primary focus for this role will be Masabi’s app, web portal, and partner integrations across the broader mobility space, with a broader view of the rider's experience across our platform as they plan, use, and pay for transit and mobility services, interacting with both digital and physical channels. 

 

Using a deep understanding of the diverse transit riders and agencies we serve, and working with internal and external partners, you will work on developing a roadmap that creates new value for riders, agencies, and the Masabi business.

 

 

Location: This role is available for candidates in Canada, anywhere on the EST time zone

 

 

Responsibilities: 

  • Define the product vision for the Rider Experience area, identifying near and long-term initiatives to build your product roadmap
  • Set the overall strategy for Masabi Rider Experience products and partnerships, defining the product offerings that agencies need (as well as those they don’t even know they need) and working with customer-facing teams on go-to-market approaches
  • Use your experience with transit apps and data as well as customer experience enablement to innovate on rider journeys and agencies’ ability to serve and engage with them, identifying opportunities to drive ridership, satisfaction, and adoption
  • Develop a deep understanding of the marketplace for rider experience technology, including transit rider needs and challenges, and emerging trends and technologies
  • Understand the specific needs and opportunities of target markets and segments in a diverse global context
  • Identify, evaluate, and execute partnership opportunities that enhance the Rider Experience, managing relationships with current and future partners for your area
  • Oversee successful delivery across your product area, and support notable launches that result in enhanced client and rider adoption and satisfaction
  • Manage complex cross-functional dependencies with product and engineering leaders to ensure a holistic approach across the portfolio and take the lead on advocating for the rider experience across the product portfolio  
  • Build and foster a strong team culture with a focus on execution and results, and provide direct leadership to product managers in the Rider Experience product area

 

 

About You:

  • Solid B2B and B2C product management experience at a global scale, ideally in transit and/or payments
  • Experience with people management, including mentoring and guiding product managers
  • Obsessed with creating magical customer experiences and able to do it at scale, preferably in a transit or payment product context 
  • A commercial mindset with a clear track record of delivering innovative and high-value solutions to hard problems 
  • Data hungry, and experienced at getting and analysing the data required to make evidence-based decisions that drive the right outcomes for our customers and business
  • Successfully launched new apps with high volume and positive customer response in the market in the past, and have managed multiple sizeable product lines
  • Experience working in fast-paced, high-growth organisations
  • Technology savvy, with exposure to front-end web and mobile development approaches, data and analytics, integration and data standards, and customer experience technology
